file_content.text: Your assistance to the Ministry will not be forgotten.
Be quick. We don't have much time.
A moment if you please, my lord. Major Damarus, Ministry of War--your skills are needed for a mission of great urgency.
I am Sith--I don't answer to you, Major.
You don't command me.
You've heard of me, and you still want my help?
You know who I am?
We have heard you can accomplish dangerous things.
Halt. I'm Major Damarus, with the Imperial Ministry of War. The Empire is contracting you for a dangerous mission, bounty hunter--starting immediately.
It doesn't sound like this great opportunity is optional.
Do I have any choice?
You would be a fool to decline.
Hold, agent. Major Damarus, Ministry of War. Your assistance is required for a mission of utmost importance.
I am already engaged in a mission of utmost importance, Major.
I'm already assigned.
Then you have two, now! Lucky you!
Hold a moment--I'm Major Damarus, with the Imperial Ministry of War. We require your immediate assistance for an important mission.
If you have a request, Major, then you will direct it to me alone.
I'm in charge here.
Ha! Someone who takes charge, I like it!
If it isn't the power of the Sith that you seek, then I'll be on my way.
Wouldn't you prefer my help?
Ha! We seek all kinds here. Stay, stay!
Sounds like you could use a professional, Major.
Why don't I take care of this?
The more guns the better, I always say. Count that one in, Damarus.
I'm with Imperial Intelligence. What's the situation?
I can help with that.
Ah, just the sort we need! Our lucky day, Damarus!
What's this got to do with that Hutt?
Is the Hutt involved?
Ah, it has everything to do with me!
Back off.
Such disrespect, when all we offer is an opportunity to help the galaxy!
My associate, Kabbura the Hutt. His cartel operates the Network Access district--the central hub for the entire galactic HoloNet.
But someone is trying to steal Network Access from us. They've broken bodily into our data center--soon, they could control the entire HoloNet!
This is a major threat to Imperial security. Breaching the Hutts' defenses and assuming this level of control should have been impossible. We need you to investigate--immediately.
I'll be glad to find the culprit for you, Major.
Of course.
All you want me to do is "investigate"?
That's it?
No--if it is within your power, you will also eliminate this threat as quickly as possible.
This is no concern of mine.
Your skills make you uniquely suited to deal with this--the main data center is almost impenetrable.
A series of well-guarded consoles is spread throughout Network Access--each with its own time-sensitive code. Get all the codes, then hurry to the data center.
Once you reach the data center access terminal with all of the timed codes, we'll contact you with further instructions. Is that clear?
Get the codes, blast the consoles, call you when I'm there.
Perfectly clear.
Let's go back over this.
To open the data center's security doors, you need a set of timed codes. These codes must be collected from consoles spread across Network Access.
You will have only a short time to collect all of the codes and reach the data center's access terminal to use them.
Be warned--none of our droid patrols are responding to our commands. They will attack on sight.
Best of luck.
Find someone else to boss around, Major. I'm leaving.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
The Minister of War will not be pleased at your refusal. So be it.
Should you meet someone less cowardly, send them to us.
Stand aside.
